glsa.title: Firebird: Data disclosure
glsa.synopsis: Firebird allows remote connections to the administrative account without verifying credentials.

background.p: Firebird is a multi-platform, open source relational database.

description.p: Viesturs reported that the default configuration for Gentoo's init script ("/etc/conf.d/firebird") sets the "ISC_PASSWORD" environment variable when starting Firebird. It will be used when no password is supplied by a client connecting as the "SYSDBA" user.

impact.p: A remote attacker can authenticate as the "SYSDBA" user without providing the credentials, resulting in complete disclosure of all databases except for the user and password database (security2.fdb).

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Firebird users should upgrade to the latest version:
Note: /etc/conf.d is protected by Portage as a configuration directory. Do not forget to use "etc-update" or "dispatch-conf" to overwrite the "firebird" configuration file, and then restart Firebird.
